laws.summary: Non-compete agreements are ENFORCEABLE in Florida with reasonable restrictions.
laws.full_text: Florida statute presumes non-competes reasonable if 6 months or less. Up to 2 years acceptable with legitimate business interest. Must be reasonable in time, geography, and scope. Keep time restriction to 2 years or less, reasonable geographic scope, protect legitimate business interest.
laws.suggestion: Non-compete is ENFORCEABLE in Florida - ensure time/geography limits are reasonable (6 months to 2 years)

laws.summary: Florida does NOT prohibit salary history inquiries.
laws.full_text: Florida has no state law restricting salary history questions. Employers may ask about previous compensation. While legal, consider avoiding salary history questions to promote pay equity.
laws.suggestion: While legal, consider avoiding salary history questions to promote pay equity

laws.summary: CANNOT require COVID-19 vaccination, testing, or mask-wearing.
laws.full_text: Florida law prohibits requiring COVID-19 vaccination, COVID-19 testing, mandating mask-wearing, or discriminating based on vaccination/immunity status.

laws.summary: Drug testing is PERMITTED in Florida.
laws.full_text: Florida allows pre-employment, reasonable suspicion, and random drug testing when properly implemented. Drug-free workplace policies encouraged.
laws.suggestion: Drug testing is legal and acceptable in Florida. Ensure drug-free workplace policy is documented.

laws.law_citation: Florida Minimum Wage Act (Fla. Stat. ยง 448.110)
laws.suggestion: Ensure compensation meets current minimum wage based on effective date

laws.summary: Florida has NO statewide ban-the-box law. Can inquire about criminal history on application.
laws.full_text: Can inquire about criminal history on application. Must follow federal FCRA requirements: disclosure, authorization, pre-adverse action, adverse action notices.
laws.suggestion: Background checks are permitted. Ensure FCRA compliance: standalone disclosure, written authorization, proper notices.
